alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 6:42PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cooke and southwestern Grayson Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 640 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Kiowa, or 7 miles west of Whitesboro. This storm was drifting slowly north. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Whitesboro, Collinsville, Callisburg, Lake Kiowa, Valley View and Sadler. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 489 and 503. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
